resources.string: No need, Development settings are enabled by default.
Enable the Android Debug Bridge (adb) interface
Display a notification when USB or network debugging is enabled
Enable TCP/IP debugging over network interfaces (Wi\u2011Fi, USB networks). This setting is reset on reboot

WARNING: When ADB over network is enabled, your phone is open for intrusions on all connected networks!

Only use this feature when you are connected on trusted networks.

Do you really want to enable this function?
Display extra info for the CPU, display, etc.
Include the foreground task when clearing all recent tasks
Show a bar with the device\'s available memory
Show a Google search bar in the recents screen
Make sure you have enabled OmniSwitch. You can do this by using \"Settings\" below
Use Slim Recents for recents view
Don\'t exclude the topmost task in recents view
Reset Slim recents colors to default?
Show recent apps panel on the left edge
Show app shortcuts on the opposite edge
Reset recents app sidebar colors to default?
Configure which icons are shown in the status bar
You have no button assigned any more to the \"Home\" action!\n\nThis can make your device unusable!
Disabled\nAdd an entry to enable this feature
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the feature entirely.
, while selecting the icon will bring up customization options

To add a %1$s, select the Add icon. Once a %1$s is added, selecting the row will change the target%2$s

To remove a %1$s, swipe the row horizontally left or right. Re-order a %1$s in the list by vertically dragging the anchor on the left.

To clear or reset to defaults, select the Reset icon.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the second pie layer entirely.
Maximum entries size has been reached
It is not possible to delete required buttons
It is not possible to delete last entry
The chosen action cannot be added twice
The chosen app did not return a valid icon or does not support image cropping. Use another app.
Show unaccounted and over-counted usage in battery statistics.
Battery history stats are going to be reset
Press on color below to apply
Lights in Do Not Disturb mode
Check the proximity sensor prior to waking up screen
Wake up device if charger is plugged/unplugged
Allowing apps to have root access upon request has the potential to be very dangerous!
View and control the root rules for apps
When Privacy Guard is enabled, the app will not be able to access personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs.
When enabling Privacy Guard for a built-in app, the app will not be able to access or provide personal data. This may cause other apps to misbehave.
Enable by default for newly-installed apps
Manage which apps have access to your personal data

In this screen you can choose which apps Privacy Guard should be active for by simply tapping on them. Selected apps will not be able to access your personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs. Long pressing an app\'s entry opens its app details screen.\n\nBuilt-in apps are not shown by default but can be revealed by selecting the respective menu option.
Are you sure you wish to reset counters?
Superuser indicator is visible when a session is active
Toggle to show superuser indicator when a session is active
Allow unlocked data access to your phone\'s storage through USB (MTP, PTP)

Your device will establish unprotected connections, everytime you connect it to a PC. Secured lock screens disable this option automatically.\n\nThis is still an experimental feature, use with caution.
Double tap on the status bar to put the device to sleep
Adjust brightness by sliding across the status bar
Enable the brightness slider in the Quick Settings panel
%1$s edge of the status bar pulls down Quick Settings
Always show Quick Settings upon a status bar pull-down
Open Quick Settings when there are %1$s notifications
Open Quick Settings when there are no notifications
Use two larger main tiles on the first row
Add, remove, or arrange QS tiles
Enable advanced settings in the Quick Settings location tile
To add a custom per-app configuration for expanded state, set "Enabled for all" to the off position
Choose a default expanded desktop style
Please enter a new label. Leave blank to revert to stock label.
Configure options for the status bar clock
Abbreviated day of the week before the time
Display custom date before the clock
Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy
Don\'t show Heads up in these applications
Don\'t show Heads up from these applications
Force Heads up from these applications
To allow applications to display interactive notifications in a pop-up window on your screen, enable Heads up.
Already added this application to the list
Force Heads up in all applications
Swiping up on peeking notifications will snooze Heads up from that application for 1 minute
Swiping up on peeking notifications will snooze Heads up from that application for %d minutes
Configure the entries to show in the Global menu (up to 6)
Automatically unlock as soon as the correct PIN/password has been entered\nNote: will only work for a 4 digit PIN/Password!
Configure options for notifications in the status bar
Select what notifications you want to "breath" in the status bar
This will give your SMS notifications a breathing effect in the status bar
This will give your missed call notifications a breathing effect in the status bar
This will give your voicemail notifications a breathing effect in the status bar
Display the number of pending notifications
Show charging current rate on lock screen
Change the default font of the lock screen clock widget
Enable to animate the battery bar while charging
You don\'t have any blocked numbers. Add an entry by touching the Add (+) button.
To prevent phone numbers from calling or messaging you, enable the blocked caller list.
You will not receive incoming calls or messages from phone numbers on the blocked caller list
Don\'t block calls from private numbers
Don\'t block calls or messages from numbers not in the contact list
Block incoming %s from numbers not in the contact list
Use . as a wildcard and * for repetition. E.g. 123.* blocks numbers starting with 123 and .*123.* blocks numbers containing 123
Unable to add invalid phone number to blocked caller list
Do you want to remove this blocked phone number?

Hide the network traffic indicator arrows
Apply translucency to the Quick Settings panel
Apply translucency to the status bar header

Show weather in the expanded status bar
Ambient display notifications will not be inverted. Use for dark themes.
Ambient display notifications will show as inverted. Use for light/stock theme.
Enable custom expanded status bar header images
Use for better text/icon visibility on bright images
Enable to show weather options on the lock screen
Enable to colorize all icons, disable to colorize only the monochrome icons
Some apps may not function at non-standard dpi.\n\nThis will restart your phone.
The value must be between %1$d and %2$d DPI
Change the position of the dashboard switches
Auto expands notifications on apps that support it
